channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The selloff on Wall Street extended into a third day, setting up the Australian sharemarket for heavy losses this morning.
item.title: ASX set to dive as Wall Street's tech plunge continues

item.description: "One cold-hearted globalist betrayal after another, that's what it was," Trump said of the military on Monday.
item.title: After Trump 'endless war' comments, army general defends military

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Australia's ecologists say they face gags on getting their information into the public domain, leading to poor policy outcomes.
item.title: Australian ecologists say their findings are 'commonly suppressed'

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: Whatever Slavik "Vic" Ramchen knew about the disappearance of his wife, former "The Price is Right" model Jacqueline Ramchen, he has taken to his grave.
item.title: Naked City podcast: Beauty and the Beast

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Judge Vanessa Baraister told Assange that she did not want to hear his case in his absence but that she would be left with no choice if he continued to shout.
item.title: 'This is nonsense': Julian Assange interjections earn stern warning

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Tech industry luminaries are calling for a quicker path out of lockdown as they warn of the severe economic and social impacts of the state's cautious exit plan.
item.title: Melbourne tech leaders fear 'tsunami of economic devastation'

item.description: American upstart Jennifer Brady continued her surprising surge at the US Open with a 6-3, 6-2 victory over Yulia Putintseva to reach her first grand slam semi-final.
item.title: Brady routs Putintseva to reach US Open semi-finals

item.description: Tour de France riders passed coronavirus tests to confirm their good health only to endure numerous crashes along the Atlantic coastline.
item.title: Sam Bennett wins Tour de France stage as riders cleared of virus

item.description: An Australian journalist for Chinese state television who was detained last month is suspected of carrying out illegal activities that endanger the country's security, China's foreign ministry said.
item.title: China says Australian journalist Cheng Lei suspected of endangering security

item.description: Tesla shares tumbled as much as 20 per cent on Tuesday after its surprise exclusion from the S&P 500 index added to the broader sell-off in technology stocks.
item.title: Tesla shares plunge as it fails to make it into S&P 500 index

item.description: In the early days of the pandemic, doctors noticed something about the people who were severely ill from COVID-19: Many were obese.
item.title: Doctors are studying why obesity may be tied to serious COVID-19

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Michael Bachelard
item.description: A study commissioned for the aged-care royal commission shows most of Australia's for-profit nursing home companies enjoy healthy profits.
item.title: Profits in nursing homes in 'weak relationship' to quality of care: report

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: BHP will shift much of its interstate FIFO workforce to Western Australia in the face of the state's border restrictions, requiring new operational employees to live in the state or be willing to move there.
item.title: BHP to axe interstate FIFO work as mining industry conforms to WA's 'hard borders'

item.description: The federal government's demonisation of Victorian Premier Dan Andrews smacks of Trumpism and will do more to divide the country then unify it.
item.title: Andrews poisonous pile-on problematic and pernicious

item.description: The technology exists to allow us to go on with our daily business while preventing the transmission of the virus.
item.title: Two dozen Starbucks patrons caught COVID, four mask-wearing staff didn't: the case for masks

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Beneath the political argy-bargy, there are serious economic questions that should be asked about the legislated rise in super contributions.
item.title: It's not the time for more forced retirement saving

item.description: Victorians could use some extra loving from our interstate mates right now.
item.title: A small, kind gesture from a Sydney friend was the perfect antidote to lockdown fatigue

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The last thing we need is to pit parents against non-parents.
item.title: Parents v non-parents at work: COVID has brought tensions to the surface

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Former NSW Labor leader John Robertson will be tasked with overhauling the state's troubled insurer icare.
item.title: Former NSW Labor leader to chair troubled public insurer

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Having previously coach Ben Hunt and Corey Norman, new Dragons coach Anthony Griffin believes he can extract the best from the maligned playmakers.
item.title: Griffin believes he can get Hunt, Norman firing again at Dragons

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: As Trent Barrett reaffirms his commitment to coach the Bulldogs, the off-field turmoil could come to a head at a meeting of the Canterbury League Club board on Wednesday.
item.title: Canterbury directors seek cover to unseat Coorey over damage to club reputation

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Cricket Australia hopes measures it is taking will give alleged victims of racism - including Andrew Symonds - the confidence to come forward if they feel they have been wronged historically.
item.title: CA reaches out to victims of racism through new series

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and superquiz, Wednesday, September 9

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Labor leader Anthony Albanese is calling for a reshaping of how Australians view working from regions after the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'Work from home': Albanese delivers vision for regional Australia

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Like any professional yearning to be taken more seriously, it appears that a rebranding could be in the offing for Mad F---ng Witches.
item.title: From swear word to acronym: feminist group tones it down

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Jose Roca has promised 2022 Biennale of Sydney will be a “biennale of our times”.
item.title: Colombian curator named for Sydney's 2022 biennale

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, September 9

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: A mammoth spending boost is being planned for the October budget to launch new construction projects that can create jobs, with the federal government promising more money and focus on long-term infrastructure.
item.title: Infrastructure money to come in the federal budget: McCormack

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Community concerns about the impacts of operating wind farms continues to dwindle, with just five complaints registered by the Wind Farm Commissioner in 2019 for five separate plants.
item.title: Wind farm complaints continue to dwindle, latest annual report shows

item.dc:creator: Mark Solomons
item.description: The waste industry and LNP opposition are calling for more transparency in the waste levy regime as it emerges the value of exemptions outweighs the amount collected.
item.title: Queensland government allows waste levy exemptions worth $400 million

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: A warming climate is increasing the risk of catastrophic bushfires, damaging hailstorms and powerful cyclones, the country's biggest insurer says.
item.title: Last season's climate catastrophes cost insurers $5.4b

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: the Melbourne-based biotech, backed by Fujifilm and Fidelity International, is recruiting patients for a human trial to test if its product can help seriously ill COVID-19 patients.
item.title: Cynata Therapeutics joins the COVID challenge

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Small business operators who lease shops or other properties are warning of a ticking rental time bomb that will activate when commercial tenants are forced to repay deferred rents.
item.title: Small business owners warn of rental time bomb

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Industrial property vacancy rates are heading to record low levels as companies scramble for storage, distribution centres and smaller city-fringe warehouses to satisfy the significant rise on e-commerce.
item.title: Industrial property leads the charge in growth rates

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Operators will use the current restrictions to refresh, rebadge and make selective acquisitions to their portfolios.
item.title: Hotel sector doing it tough but optimistic of recovery

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: The former Penrith coach has been given one of the hardest jobs in rugby league. Is he up to the challenge of delivering St George Illawarra's first premiership since 2010?
item.title: Can Anthony Griffin lead the Dragons to the Promised Land?

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A development site in Hansworth Street has sold to a private Chinese syndicate for $11.5 million.
item.title: Property firm sells development land for $11.5m

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Women allowed to vote, comedy 'Stuck Oil' and Sydney Hunt Club meets.
item.title: In the Herald: September 9, 1893

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Brisbane City Council wants to trial e-scooters in bike lanes rather than on footpaths.
item.title: Council wants e-scooters in bike lanes to protect pedestrians

item.description: In a milestone for Australian domestic air travel, Trans Australia Airlines (TAA) inaugurated its Melbourne-Sydney passenger service.
item.title: From the Archives, 1946: Inaugural flight by TAA

item.description: I was part of an audit of a large development that was one week away from completion.
item.title: Millions of dollars in repairs nipped in the bud: Sydney's new building sheriff is cracking down

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Dozens of public and private labs across the state have been processing COVID-19 tests, including a lab that normally tests for animal diseases.
item.title: Vet virus lab processing human COVID-19 samples to help NSW maintain testing capacity

item.description: When we get towards the end of the coronavirus crisis, our leaders will have some serious thinking to do about a number of pressing health issues facing the country.
item.title: The government needs to step up to tackle Australia's looming Alzheimer's crisis

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 9, 2020

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Researchers who worked on the modelling say they weren't asked to consider upgrades to Victoria's contact tracing system.
item.title: Modelling used to back lockdown plan 'outdated'

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: The Melbourne Greens will launch their campaign for the city council election this week, naming Apsara Sabaratnam as the candidate for lord mayor.
item.title: Rates would double for gaming venues, halve for arts and hospitality under Greens' council poll plan

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Many of the aged care homes hardest hit by Victoria's coronavirus outbreaks were given a clean bill of health by the federal regulator only months before their first infections.
item.title: Federal aged care watchdog approved homes with worst COVID-19 outbreaks

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Carlton coach David Teague said he felt 'quite comfortable' when Matthew Cottrell lined up for what proved to be the match-winning goal against Sydney on Tuesday night.
item.title: 'I love his story': Blues' match-winner makes his mark

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: It’s no secret that Trump has been pushing federal health authorities to speed up the timeline to develop a vaccine as soon as possible.
item.title: Rush-job vaccine could be Trump's electoral surprise weapon
